column4: I have Breezy 5.10 Installed right now but need to upgrade the Samba. the Version in the Repositories isn't the latest. How can I install the lates version of Samba
: coompile it from source?
: compile it even
i have the Dapper Live CD and seem to be a newer version there
compiling from source is not my friend.... I never have any luck :(
if i can just upgrade my Samba i won't bother with Dapper

: is there a specific feature or fix found in the latest version of Samba that you must have?  if not then you really don't have to get the latest version of Samba, or anything else for that matter... ;-P
The newer version is Suppose to fix a problem with My Mac OS Hanging when it gets to the linux box... Seems to be a known issue according to the kubuntu forums
...and why is that topyli

: the kubuntu forums are not authoritative for Samba fixes.  if such an issue exists, and has been fixed, it will be listed in the Samba changelog / release notes, which are authoritative sources of information on Samba...
the latest version of Samba is 3.0.21 ... the latest in the Repositories is 3.0.14
i ran the live CD and the version there is 3.0.20
it suppose to be enough
so how do i build from that then??
: have a look at Samba changes: http://us2.samba.org/samba/history/samba-3.0.21a.html  NO mention of any Mac OS X related issues going back to version 3.0.4 ;-)
i need to add the dapper repositories right?
I was reading this forum and it talks about it here
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=108691&highlight=samba
so what exactly do i need to add to have the repos
ok kinda thought so but good to make sure
: that forum says nothing about requiring the latest version of Samba...you don't really need it.  you should spare yourself the grief of trying to go to bleeding edge when you don't need it.
